text: Hafskael's Yard, nestled at the base of towering cliffs, stands as a testament to Bjornling craftsmanship and maritime prowess. Here, the master shipwright Hafskael oversees the construction of legendary longships, each vessel infused with the blessings of the Ruinous Powers. With the relentless sound of sawing and hammering echoing against the cliffs, this bustling shipyard serves as the beating heart of Bjornling naval might, where elite Huscarls gather to plan conquests and legendary expeditions

The southern extreme of the Sarl Coast is the Kalti Delta and its eponymous river. The Kalti Delta is a huge salt marsh, expanding inland into an even larger freshwater one. The river itself later splits but goes nowhere of note; it's just a route inland. The marsh is a mystery, as few dare the dangers of River Trolls without good cause. Anything could be in there, a compelling reason for exploration.

Valmir is an Aesling Chaos Lord and a former lieutenant of the Everchosen Asavar Kul, who declared himself "Emperor of Chaos" in the aftermath of Kul's defeat in the Great War Against Chaos in 2304 IC. He succeeded in destroying the Dwarfen hold of Kraka Drak.

Kurgan are nomadic people, they rarely stick around one place too long. Yet near the Volary, a known crossroad between the Eastern Steppes, the Old World and Cathay the Kurgan regularly gather in the tens of thousands - with camps and tribes waging wars within wars. It is here Zar's often determine where they will lead their tribe next, and it is here where Zar's often find their death in the duelling pits.

Vinnskor used to be a Baersonling village untill it was plundered and sacked by the Aesling in a way that is so brutal it became a sanctum for those who worship the god of slaughter known as the Temple of Heimkel. The Baersonling however, now driven in to the hands of Tzeentch, still aim to one day reclaim their lands.
